flawed_nl_solution:
Joe can buy a game for $50 and sell it for $30, so he is losing $50 - $30 = $<<50-30=10>>10 each month when he buys and sells a game.
Joe starts out with $240 and he buys a game and sells a game he loses $10 per month, so it will take $240/$10 = <<240/10=24>>24 months until he is out of money.
#### 24

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 10. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
